entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 180 to 240 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 35 mm/h expected. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 220 to 280 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 35 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a total of 200 to 250 mm of rain on top of what has already accumulated, especially about the higher ground. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected Wednesday morning, afternoon and evening. Note that there is a low risk of localised downpours bringing rainfall intensities of 25 to 40 mm/h from Wednesday afternoon. Impact: Dangerous river conditions, flooding, and slips likely. Dangerous driving conditions and road closures are expected. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: High. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been increased to High.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Note there is a risk of downpours bringing hourly rainfall intensities of 25 to 40 mm about Great Barrier Island and Auckland north of the Harbour Bridge from Wednesday afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: High. Changes: Note that the chance of upgrade to an Orange Warning for Great Barrier Island and areas north of the Harbour Bridge is high but moderate elsewhere.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 120 to 160 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h at times. Localised downpours of 25 to 40 mm per hour are possible. Note, heavy showers are possible before the onset of the Warning. Impact: Dangerous river conditions, flooding, and slips likely. Dangerous driving conditions and road closures are expected. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: High. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been increased to High.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Easterly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
